p.text: [p]Being the new kid in school is no picnic. At your old school you had tons of friends, but now you don't even have one. Then you meet Nick. He asks you to join the Horror Club.[/p] [p]The Horror Club meets in an old mansion known as Bat Wing Hall. It's dark. It's spooky. And it's where your adventure begins.[/p] [p]The members of the Horror Club are going on a scavenger hunt. If you join the red team, you find out the truth about your new friends – they're actually monsters! One is a green-skinned reptile. Another is a hulking giant! If you join the blue team, you get turned into a furry-faced vampire bat![/p]

[p]“This town stinks!”[/p] [p]It's Friday afternoon – the end of your first week at your new school. Your family just moved to this town last month. And so far no one at school has even tried to be your friend.[/p] [p]Day after day, you sit in class waiting for someone to talk to you. Waiting and staring at all the strange faces around you. How can you possibly go through the year without any friends? you wonder. You're cool. You know you are. You had tons of friends at your old school.[/p] [p]You trudge home slowly. All you have to look forward to is a boring weekend of watching TV with your parents and your bratty little brother. Then something hits the back of your jacket.[/p] [p]You whirl around. A pebble drops onto the ground. You glance up – and notice a brown-haired boy about your own age.[/p] [p]“Hi!” he calls out. “I'm Nick!”[/p] [p]“Hi,” you reply and introduce yourself.[/p] [p]“We're in the same class at school,” Nick says.[/p] [p][em]That's funny[/em], you think. You don't remember seeing him there. But you smile anyway. You're so happy someone is finally talking to you.[/p] [p]“I live there,” Nick tells you. He points to a two-story green house on the next block. You gaze back at him, shocked.[/p] [p]“But you can't live there!” you exclaim. “There's no way!”[/p]

[p]“What do you mean I can't live there?” Nick asks, laughing. “I know my own house.”[/p] [p]“I live next door,” you tell him. You point to the red-brick house next to the green one. “The green house has been empty all month. There haven't been any lights on. No cars in the driveway.”[/p] [p]“I was on vacation with my family. We got back last night,” Nick says. “What do you think of school?”[/p] [p]“Okay, I guess,” you reply. You're afraid to say anything more. You never know – maybe this kid Nick actually [em]likes[/em] school.[/p] [p]“Can you believe how much homework our teacher gave us this weekend?” Nick complains. He kicks a stone down the street as you walk. “All the kids who had Mr. McCormick last year say he's really tough. And mean. A total monster!”[/p] [p]You agree. The next thing you know you and Nick are comparing favorite rock groups and comic books. Both of you collect Spider-Man comics. Nick has all the first issues from the last five years, too![/p] [p]“Comics are cool,” Nick says. “But do you know what's even cooler?”[/p] [p]“What?” you ask.[/p] [p]“Horror stories!” Nick exclaims. “In fact, I –” He stops talking and stares at you.[/p]

[p]“What?” you ask. “What about horror stories?”[/p] [p]“It's probably way too scary for you,” Nick replies.[/p] [p]“Nothing's too scary for me!” you boast.[/p] [p]“That's because you've never been to the Horror Club,” Nick says.[/p] [p]“What's that?”[/p] [p]Nick grins. “It's a club I belong to. You've got to be really brave to be a member. When we meet, we tell spooky stories. Really scary!”[/p] [p]“Cool!” you reply. “I love scary stories. Can I join?”[/p] [p]“If you think you can handle it,” Nick says. “We meet every Friday night at Bat Wing Hall. That's the deserted house at the dead end of our street. It was old Professor Krupnik's house.”[/p] [p]“I've seen the house. It looks haunted,” you tell Nick with a laugh.[/p] [p]“Don't laugh,” he warns you. “It [em]is[/em] haunted.”[/p]

[p]You crouch over the crack. Your bat sonar tells you that it goes down a long, long way. It might even go on forever. And you're almost afraid to imagine what you might find inside it.[/p] [p]Still, you're a bat.[/p] [p]You're trapped in the crypt.[/p] [p]What have you got to lose?[/p] [p]You take a deep breath to calm yourself. You do a couple of warm-up flaps of your wings. Then, before you can change your mind, you dive head first into the crack. But you're no longer flying![/p] [p]Instead, you're falling, falling straight down. What are you doing wrong?[/p] [p]In a panic, you check out your wings. To your amazement, they're gone! Those are [em]arms[/em] flailing around. [em]Your[/em] arms. You're a kid again![/p] [p]You don't have time to celebrate. You're falling faster now. And faster. Will you ever land? And will you survive the crash? And if you do, where will you be?[/p]

[p]You want Marcie's help. You swoop around the neighborhood, looking for Marcie's family's name on a mailbox. At last you find it, in front of a small two-story brick house. You peer into all the windows until you find Marcie alone in the living room. She seems to be baby-sitting her little brother, who is about two years old.[/p] [p]You find an open window, then fly into the house. You perch on a curtain in the living room. Below, Marcie and her brother are playing a game with cardboard letters. While you watch, Marcie moves some of the letters.[/p] [p]“C-A-T,” Marcie tells her brother. “That spells [em]cat[/em], Darryl. Can you say cat?”[/p] [p]“I'm hungry!” the little boy cries.[/p] [p]“I'll get some Jell-O,” Marcie says. “See if you can spell cat.” She disappears into the hall.[/p] [p][em]What luck![/em] you think. The letters are small and lightweight! You're sure you'll be able to move them yourself and write out a message to Marcie![/p] [p]You swoop down to the floor. The letters are in a big box. You start to sort through the letters when Darryl suddenly reaches for you.[/p] [p]“DOGGIE!” he cries. He grabs one of your wings and pulls.[/p]

[p]Debbie is standing by herself in the corner. You figure Nick and Connor must still be in the kitchen. You approach cautiously.[/p] [p]“Do you really think this scavenger hunt is for real?” she asks, glancing toward the kitchen.[/p] [p]“Yeah,” you say. “You guys [em]promised[/em] that you'll let me go if I find the items by midnight.”[/p] [p]Debbie starts laughing – a hideous cackling laugh. “Fool!” she cries. “It's a joke! You're never going to make it out!”[/p] [p]You don't know whether to believe her or not.[/p] [p]“What do you mean?” you ask.[/p] [p]Debbie slithers closer. “I'm on your side,” she whispers. “I used to be a regular kid like you. Then I joined the Horror Club. Now look what's happened to me!”[/p] [p]You stare in amazement at Debbie's hideous monster face. Is she for real? Was she really once a kid like you?[/p] [p]“I want to help you,” she says. “If you follow me, I'll help you escape.”[/p]
p.next: If you think Debbie is telling the truth
If you think it's best to continue the hunt

p.text: [p]“You're on!” Connor growls. “But you go last.” Then he plugs in two more sets of controls. “Hey, what are you doing?” you cry. “These are for Nick and Debbie,” he replies. “No fair!” you protest. “I said I'd play against [em]you[/em] .”[/p] [p]“It's all of us or no deal,” Connor snarls.[/p] [p]What can you say? You nod and sigh. “Sure. Okay.”[/p] [p]“Nick plays first,” Connor announces. “And remember – you have to beat [em]all[/em] of us to win!”[/p] [p]Nick begins to play. You're not too worried, though. You've seen Debbie play. She couldn't even handle level one. How good could Nick be?[/p] [p]Nick makes his first moves. Uh-oh. Nick is excellent.[/p] [p]Connor and Debbie bomb out early. But you and Nick move quickly through the lower levels. Finally, you both reach level twelve – the top level! You've never reached this level before.[/p] [p]Beads of sweat trickle down your face. Up, down, jump! Right, left, shoot! You operate the controls like a pro.[/p] [p]But then the Mud Monsters throw out a tidal wave of mud.[/p] [p]Do you jump the wave or try to duck under it?[/p] [p][em]Quick! Make a decision![/em][/p]
p.next: To jump the wave
To duck under

p.text: [p]“SHAKE!” you instruct the werewolf.[/p] [p]The eleventh chime rings out. [em]Hurry[/em], you think. [em]Hurry[/em] ![/p] [p]The werewolf holds out his paw. Quickly, you pluck three hairs from his forearm.[/p] [p]The final chime never rings. Instead there is an enormous thunderclap. The force shakes the house.[/p] [p]“I did it!” you cry, dancing in a circle. “I got the four items!”[/p] [p]There is no answer.[/p] [p]You gaze around the basement. It's empty. No Nick. No Debbie. No Connor. No werewolf![/p] [p]“Where is everyone?” you shout. “I won!”[/p] [p]The fire in the furnace has turned to cold ashes. You head for the staircase and climb upstairs.[/p] [p]“Hey, Nick! Debbie? Connor?” you call out.[/p] [p]“In here!” cries a familiar voice. It's Nick![/p] [p]You race up the steps, two at a time. You follow his voice to the living room of Bat Wing Hall. You feel around in your pocket. You still have the human bone, the mummy's bandage, and the were wolf's hairs. In your other hand, you hold the witch's broom.[/p] [p]You have all the items on the list. The monsters have to let you go – right? You step into the living room.[/p]

[p]You step up to the door and grasp the ring in both your hands. It's covered with rust and cobwebs, and you have a feeling it hasn't been moved in a long time.[/p] [p]You pull on it, but the thing won't budge. You clutch the ring even tighter and put all your weight into it.[/p] [p]A hideous screeching noise fills the air. What is making that ghastly sound? Slowly, slowly, the heavy stone door swings open.[/p] [p]Holding your breath, you tiptoe inside. You see a large casket sitting on a stone platform in the middle of the dark room. For a moment, you can't move. You stare at the casket and think: There's a dead person in there. A dead person![/p] [p]Yikes! Something just grabbed at your hair. You brush it away. And gasp.[/p] [p]A bat flutters off into the darkness, its fangs glinting in the moonlight. Maybe catching a bat isn't such a great idea, you decide.[/p] [p]You quickly search the tomb for scary stuff to bring back to your teammates, but you find nothing except dust and cobwebs. With a final glance, you leave the tomb to rejoin your friends.[/p] [p]There's only one problem. You don't see them anywhere. You're all alone.[/p]

[p]You swoop up the stairs as fast as you can.[/p] [p]Marcie's right behind you.[/p] [p]You fly into a bedroom. From the crib you know it must be Darryl's room. Next to the crib is a basket containing stuffed animals. There's a stuffed dog, a zebra, a gorilla, a frog, a pussycat, and several stuffed teddy bears.[/p] [p]There's no time to think. Quickly, you flop down into the basket with the other animals. You stay completely still and try to look cute.[/p] [p]A moment later Marcie tears into the room. “Where did that bat go?” she shouts angrily. She stops and gazes all around the room. You hold your breath.[/p] [p]“Hmmph!” she snorts. “It must have gone into my parents' room.” She turns and leaves.[/p] [p]You don't waste a moment. Quickly, you fly toward the window. It's open just a crack – but a crack is all you need. You squeeze yourself through the opening and fly into the warm evening breeze.[/p] [p]You're sure you'll have better luck at Lara's house.[/p] [p]At least – you hope you will.[/p]

[p]“I'm going to search the main floor, you tell the monsters.”[/p] [p]“Lots of luck!” Nick sneers.[/p] [p]You glance around the dark creepy mansion. You know escape is going to be tough. You decide you'll do the scavenger hunt. You'll play along with the monsters, but still search for a way out. Either way, you promise yourself, you won't let them turn you into a monster![/p] [p]You search the living room first. A curtain of cobwebs dangles from the ceiling. You have to part them to search the room. Yuck![/p] [p]The only furniture in the room is an old sofa and two overstuffed chairs. You lift the cushions to search for the creepy things on the list. Could there really be a human bone under there, you wonder? You nearly choke from the flying dust – but no bone.[/p] [p]You peer under the furniture. Nothing.[/p] [p]Then Connor sneaks up on you. He kicks a dust-ball in your face. “The clock is ticking!” he booms. You stare up at his one bloodshot eye and escape into the next room.[/p] [p]It's an old-fashioned dining room. A long wooden table stands in the middle of the room. As you step toward the table, something black and hairy jumps out at you![/p]

[p]Could it be a human scream? You've never heard a human scream that sounds like that![/p] [p]You whirl around in the direction of the scream.[/p] [p]Debbie! Debbie is the one screaming.[/p] [p]“NOOOOO!” she shrieks again and hurries over to you.[/p] [p]“Can't you read?” Debbie cries. The warts on her face ooze green goo. “This is not what you want! These aren't [em]mummy[/em] bandages!” Debbie snatches the bandages from your pockets and tosses them on the floor. “Don't waste time!” she cries.[/p] [p]You step back and try to think. There's no way to escape from the kitchen – Connor is guarding the doors, and Nick is by the window. You [em]have[/em] to find the items on that list.[/p] [p]You gaze around and then head for a tall, narrow closet.[/p] [p]And freeze in horror.[/p] [p]A thick pool of something red and sticky is seeping underneath the door. It looks like – blood![/p] [p][em]What do you do now?[/em][/p]
p.next: To open the closet door
To go back and check the dining room again

p.text: [p]You're sure Nick, Debbie, and Connor are playing a joke on you.[/p] [p]You turn and stare at Nick's reptile-like face. A long, forked tongue darts out at you. You wonder how he does that.[/p] [p]“Excellent costumes, guys,” you say. “You really got me.”[/p] [p]Connor growls.[/p] [p]“Okay. Enough. Joke's over,” you announce. “Take the masks off.”[/p] [p]Nobody moves.[/p] [p]You reach over to Nick and grab his face. If he won't take his mask off, you'll do it for him.[/p] [p]The scales feel slippery. You tug and tug.[/p] [p]And then you know.[/p] [p]It isn't a mask.[/p] [p]Nick is a monster![/p] [p]Too bad you didn't believe him.[/p] [p]Too bad – because with one chomp of Nick's reptile-sharp fangs, you will come to a monstrous[/p] [p class="end"]END[/p]

[p]Then you hear laughter and footsteps. You jump up from your hiding place and peek out the window. Marcie, Lara, and Martin are standing on the porch. You rush outside.[/p] [p]“Sorry we're late,” Marcie tells you. “But we stopped for pizza. Want some?” She holds the pizza box out toward you. Normally triple cheese with extra pepperoni would make your mouth water, but today it smells disgusting. You're more in the mood for moths.[/p] [p]“No thanks,” you say. You have no time to lose. “Listen, you've got to come with me to the cemetery.” You grab Marcie's arm, but she yanks it back.[/p] [p]“I know I'm acting weird,” you explain quickly. “But there's a reason. The other night at the graveyard, something happened. I was transformed – into a bat.”[/p] [p]“Right!” Lara cries. “And I became the Bride of Frankenstein.”[/p] [p]“It's true,” you insist.[/p] [p]Martin snorts. “Great story!” he says, laughing.[/p] [p]“Yeah,” Marcie agrees. “Why don't you save it for the next meeting of the Horror Club?”[/p] [p]“It's not a story!” You are practically yelling. In just a few seconds, the sun will go down and you'll never be able to explain![/p]

[p]It shouldn't be too hard to make the house seem haunted – especially since it [em]is[/em] haunted! You turn to the ghost. “I have an idea,” you say, “but I need your help.”[/p] [p]“You want me to help you?” the ghost booms.[/p] [p]“Yes,” you reply and whisper your idea to him.[/p] [p]“All right,” the ghost of Professor Krupnik grumbles.[/p] [p]You're very relieved. “Great!” you cry. “And after it works, you'll unbat me.”[/p] [p]“We'll see,” the ghost mutters. You don't like the sound of that. But you don't have any choice.[/p] [p]You hurry back to the mansion. “We've got to leave!” you tell your friends. “This place is haunted by the ghost of Professor Krupnik!”[/p] [p]“Yeah, sure,” says Lara. She yawns.[/p] [p]At that moment the front door to the mansion creaks open. The ghost drifts into the room.[/p] [p]“That's a ghost?” asks Martin. “It just looks like an old man.”[/p] [p]“OOOOOOOOOOHHHH!” Professor Krupnik moans. “OOOOOOOHHHH!”[/p] [p]“Even if it [em]is[/em] a ghost, it doesn't look too scary,” Marcie adds. You can't believe it. The Horror Club kids aren't even afraid of a real ghost![/p]
p.next: If you try a completely different plan now
If you want to help the ghost scare them away

p.text: [p]“No offense,” you tell Debbie. “But I'm going to continue the scavenger hunt.”[/p] [p]For a moment Debbie only stares at you. Then her purple skin begins to grow darker. And darker. “How dare you doubt me!” she cries. “Is this the thanks I get for trying to help?”[/p] [p]She raises her arms. And now you see that she has long – very sharp – claws! She lunges for you.[/p] [p]You leap back, trying to decide which direction to run, when something goes [em]SPLAT![/em] – right on your neck.[/p] [p]You reach up and feel prickly hair. And legs. And a warm round body. There's a [em]tarantula[/em] on your neck![/p] [p]The creature's legs dig into your skin, like sharp needles. It begins to nibble at your skin. You scream and flick it to the ground. Debbie laughs. She reaches for another deadly spider.[/p] [p]But you spot a dark hall and race down it. Debbie and her tarantulas follow. You run and run. And find yourself standing in front of two doors. One is painted orange. The other is painted green.[/p] [p]Pick a door quickly – before you are eaten alive by the tarantulas![/p]
p.next: If you choose the orange door
If you choose the green door

p.text: [p]“The Horror Club sounds great!” you tell Nick. “Count me in!”[/p] [p]“I'll meet you in front of your house at nine o'clock tonight,” Nick says. You agree and say good-bye. Then you rush into your kitchen to find your parents. You tell them you've made a friend, and you've been invited to a club meeting. They're so happy for you. Of course, you don't tell them that the meeting is in a deserted, boarded-up old house![/p] [p]At nine o'clock, you join Nick under the elm tree in your front yard. A skinny, fidgety girl with messy, long dark hair waits with Nick.[/p] [p]“This is Debbie,” he tells you. “She's a member of the club, too.”[/p] [p]“Hi,” Debbie says. You can barely see her face under all her thick hair. And she always seems to be squirming about! You wonder what's with this strange girl.[/p] [p]You follow your new friends up the hill to the end of the long dark street. The farther you go, the fewer houses there are. At the end of the road, all the streetlights are out. The sky is pitch-black. If it weren't for Nick's flashlight, you'd probably trip over your own feet.[/p] [p]“There it is,” Nick says, pointing. “Bat Wing Hall.”[/p]

[p][em]ZZZAAANNNGGG![/em] With a loud vibrating noise, the glass box vanishes! The witch stands before you. The magic worked![/p] [p]“Thank you. Oh, thank you,” the witch gushes.[/p] [p]“No problem,” you say. “But time is running –”[/p] [p]“You're right,” the witch says. “Time's running out.” She thrusts her broom into your hands. “Be careful how you remove the straw,” she warns.[/p] [p]“Excellent!” you cry. “Now all I have to do is pluck three hairs from a werewolf!”[/p] [p]“Easy!” the witch scoffs. “I know where to find a werewolf.”[/p] [p]“You do?” you ask incredulously.[/p] [p]“Sure,” the witch says. “The werewolf is in the basement. Or at least he was two hundred years ago. You can take the elevator Professor Krupnik installed.” She proudly points to a small elevator in the corner of the attic. Then she disappears in a puff of bright pink smoke.[/p] [p]You hurry to the elevator. The door magically opens. Quickly, you step inside. But the broom gets stuck in the opening![/p] [p]You frantically try to pull out a straw, but none will come out. You could break one off, you think. But then you remember the witch's warning.[/p]
p.next: If you take a chance and break off a straw
Try to squeeze the broom into the elevator

p.text: [p]“What is it?” you cry, as your body hits the ground.[/p] [p]“We've got to be careful,” Nick whispers. “If anyone catches us going in the front door, we could be in big trouble. We're not really allowed in here.”[/p] [p]You nod. And watch Debbie as she squirms and glances around nervously.[/p] [p]You wonder why your new friends are so jumpy. You can't imagine how anyone could possibly see you in the darkness. But you figure Nick and Debbie know what they're doing.[/p] [p]You stand and follow Nick and Debbie across the porch. Keeping as quiet as possible, you pull off the broken boards on the front door.[/p] [p]You enter the dark house.[/p] [p]The air in the entryway is stale and dusty. You hold back a sneeze. Nick motions for you to follow him.[/p] [p]You creep after Nick and Debbie down a dark hallway. The floorboards creak loudly with each step.[/p] [p]Then you enter a big, dimly lit living room. A broken chandelier sways from the ceiling. The faded wallpaper hangs in pieces from the walls. Dirty sheets cover what appear to be old sofas and chairs.[/p] [p]And then you see them![/p]

[p]You maneuver your controls quickly and jump over the mud wave.[/p] [p]You made it! Now if you can just destroy the Mud Monsters, you'll win the game.[/p] [p]You concentrate hard. Focus on the screen. You move through snapping turtles and sea monsters. Then, at the right moment, you drop the bombs you saved from level seven.[/p] [p]Boom! You blow up the Mud Monsters' nest.[/p] [p]CONGRATULATIONS! the screen blinks, YOU HAVE DESTROYED THE MUD MONSTERS![/p] [p]“I win!” you cry.[/p] [p]“I don't believe it!” Nick yells, throwing down his controls.[/p] [p]“How could you lose like that?” Debbie shrieks at Nick.[/p] [p]“How could you let a kid beat you?” Connor snarls. Everyone starts arguing. Debbie and Connor yell at Nick. Nick screams back. They have all forgotten about you.[/p] [p]You decide not to wait around for them to show you out. You're sure you can't trust these monsters. You make a break for the door.[/p] [p]You dodge out into the hall and race down the stairs. Through the downstairs rooms. To the front door. You're almost free![/p] [p]You grab the doorknob, begin to pull – when someone grabs your shoulder and drags you back![/p]

[p]You step out of the elevator. You hold the broom tightly in one hand and choose one straw. Then, with the other hand, you snap it off.[/p] [p]You wait for a moment, standing motionless. Nothing happens. Everything is okay. You breathe a sigh of relief, then stuff the straw in your pocket along with the human bone and the mummy's bandage.[/p] [p]The scavenger hunt is almost over![/p] [p]You step into the elevator. But – hey, wait! The elevator has vanished![/p] [p]You plummet through the darkness.[/p] [p]Down, down![/p] [p]There's no way to stop! You have nothing to help you! In a moment, you'll smash into the basement floor![/p] [p]Too bad – it seems you made a mistake with the witch's broom. And for you, alas, it's the last straw![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You decide the best thing would be to tell your friends the truth. You fly outside and as soon as you hit the light, you transform into a kid again. After the movie, your friends rush up to you. “Where were you?” Marcie demands.[/p] [p]“I didn't want to watch the movie,” you reply.[/p] [p]“Did it scare you?” Lara teases.[/p] [p]“Afraid of bats?” Martin chimes in. He gives your shoulder a playful punch.[/p] [p]“Actually,” you tell him, “the problem is just the opposite. The truth is, I [em]am[/em] a bat.”[/p] [p]All three of your friends stare at you wide-eyed. Then they begin to laugh.[/p] [p]“Right,” says Marcie. “And I'm Frankenstein's monster.”[/p] [p]“Something happened in the graveyard,” you explain. “I was in the crypt, and later that night I turned into a bat.”[/p] [p]Marcie and Lara are laughing so hard they can't even talk.[/p] [p]“Wait a minute,” Martin says, frowning. “Are you serious?”[/p] [p]“Yes!” you say, relieved that someone finally understands.[/p] [p]But Martin guffaws harder. “What a great story!” he cries.[/p]

[p]“Maybe there are instructions inside the crypt,” you say. You enter, and now you see more writing on the inside of the door. Somehow you never noticed it before:[/p] [p]WARNING: DO NOT USE THE POWER OF THE RING MORE THAN ONCE PER YEAR. RESULTS CAN BE UNPREDICTABLE.[/p] [p]You point out the words to Marcie.[/p] [p]“Oh, no!” she cries. “What can we do now?”[/p] [p]You gaze at your changed friends sadly. Martin seems to be better at flying now, but Lara is having trouble hopping.[/p] [p]“I think we'll have to wait till next year,” you tell her.[/p] [p]Marcie hurries across the street to the mansion and returns with an old shoe box. Carefully, you put Lara and Martin into it.[/p] [p]“Don't worry,” you say to them. “We'll be able to turn you back in a year. And in the meantime, we'll take very good care of you.”[/p] [p]Now all you have to do is figure out how to tell your mother about your strange new pets![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“Okay,” you tell the Egyptian king. “I'll stay.”[/p] [p]“Wonderful!” the king exclaims. He steps down from his throne.[/p] [p]“Follow me,” he says.[/p] [p]You stick your tongue out at the priest. Then you turn and follow the king from the throne room, down a long hallway and into a small room.[/p] [p]The room has dark marble walls and a low stone ceiling. In the center of the room is a stone table. Your legs begin to tremble when you see what rests on the top – the tray with the strange instruments. The mummy-making instruments![/p] [p]“Lie down on the table,” the king commands you.[/p] [p]“B-but – you said I was going to stay with you!” you protest.[/p] [p]“That's right,” the king agrees. “But I am old. I will die soon. And I want to bring you to the afterlife with me. You need to be mummified now!”[/p] [p]The king calls for the priests. They dash in and strap you to the cold table. You kick and yell, but no one pays attention. They are too busy preparing the bandages. [em]Your[/em] bandages![/p] [p]One priest holds two instruments over your head. They look like a long, skinny hook and a long, skinny spoon.[/p] [p]“What are you going to do?” you cry.[/p]

[p][em]Maybe[/em], you think, [em]the ring has to turn[/em] before [em]the door is shut[/em] .[/p] [p]You're not sure you're strong enough to do it. But you are determined to try.[/p] [p]You swoop down and perch on the rusty ring. Then, while your friends continue to push on the door, you grasp the iron ring in your tiny claws and try to turn it.[/p] [p]At first, nothing happens.[/p] [p]You take a deep breath and try again. Every little bat muscle in you strains. You grunt, you groan. You're shaking all over from the effort.[/p] [p]But at last, the ring starts to turn. And you can feel the door moving inch by tiny inch.[/p] [p]A green mist bubbles out of the tomb. “What's that?” Marcie cries.[/p] [p]“Keep pushing!” you squeak.[/p] [p]Luckily your Horror Club friends don't need any encouragement. They continue to push. With a deafening [em]CLANK![/em] the door slams shut.[/p] [p]The ground begins to shake. You hear thunder, and lightning crackles across the sky. An instant later, Lara screams. Your teammates are all staring at you.[/p] [p]Did closing the tomb work?[/p]

[p][em]I can't believe there is a real mummy in this house[/em], you think to yourself as you chase him down hallway after dark hallway.[/p] [p]The mummy turns a corner. You are about to turn, too, when you hear familiar voices behind a pink door. You peek through a crack in the door – and spot Nick, Connor, and Debbie. They seem to be talking about you![/p] [p]The monsters obviously don't know you are there. Should you stop and listen? Maybe you will hear something that will help you escape.[/p] [p]Or is it better to follow the mummy?[/p]
p.next: To eavesdrop
To follow the mummy

p.text: [p]You decide to return to the cemetery tonight. You can't stand to be a bat another second! With a last shuddering look at your new bat self, you climb down from the sink. Then you crawl up the wall to your window ledge. From your new, shorter, bat's-eye view, the yard below looks very far away, even though you're only on the second floor.[/p] [p]Well, you've got wings – might as well try them. You're a little nervous about your lack of flight experience. But you've got no choice. You try flapping your wings, and the next thing you know you're lifting up, up – out into the dark night air.[/p] [p]The wind rushes beneath your wings and you soar higher and higher. You sneak a peek down at the yard far below. Big mistake! For just a moment you're so scared you forget to flap your wings. Instantly, you begin to plummet to the ground.[/p] [p]Frantically, you begin flapping again, and manage to level out. Flying isn't as easy as it looks, you realize. You try to turn to the right, and find yourself flying upside down instead. Then you bump into the side of a tree.[/p] [p]After some practice, you begin to get the hang of flying. Unfortunately, you made so many twists and turns while you were learning that you have no idea where you are.[/p] [p][em]What now?[/em][/p]

[p]Before you go too far, you feel a strange tingling sensation all over your body. But you don't have time to worry about it. You must escape![/p] [p]The monsters are gaining on you.[/p] [p]You fly up the stairs now. Two steps at a time.[/p] [p]And then you stop. The tingling is getting worse.[/p] [p]Keep going, you say to yourself. You've got to keep going. The monsters are only a few steps behind.[/p] [p]You try to run. But you can't![/p] [p]Something's wrong. You're stuck in the middle of the staircase! You can't move up. Your legs are paralyzed![/p] [p]Nick, Debbie, and Connor close in on you. Connor's odor makes you gag. But you're trapped. Frozen in place.[/p] [p]“Need some help?” Nick asks with an evil snicker.[/p]
p.next: If you accept the monsters' help
If you refuse

p.text: [p]You turn to the right. The walls are covered with dirty, dingy wallpaper. It flakes under your fingers as you grope your way through the hall.[/p] [p]You hope you are going in the right direction. But you have no idea where to find a witch's broom – or a werewolf![/p] [p]Suddenly, you spot a doorway and hear faint beeping noises coming from the room. As you move closer, flashes of light escape the entrance. You enter the room.[/p] [p]Oh, no! There's Nick, Debbie, and Connor![/p] [p]You're about to run, but then you notice the monsters are sitting around a large screen. Debbie and Connor have controls in their hands. You realize that they are playing a video game![/p] [p]“Stop, Connor!” Debbie shrieks. “Stop cheating!”[/p] [p]“Shut up!” Connor retorts. “All I have to do is get three apples, and then I can bomb you back to level one!”[/p] [p]You watch in amazement. You recognize the game they're playing – [em]Mud Monsters[/em] . You can't believe that these three hideous monsters are playing your favorite video game – and playing it badly![/p] [p]It gives you an idea. The idea is dangerous and very risky – but if it works, it might save your life.[/p] [p][em]What is your idea?[/em][/p]

[p]“I don't believe it!” Lara shrieks, pointing at you.[/p] [p]You realize you and Lara are eye-to-eye. That's a promising sign. With your heart pounding, you dare to glance down at your feet. Where only a moment ago, you had claws, now you see your favorite sneakers. Hooray![/p] [p]You're a kid again![/p] [p]“We did it!” Marcie cries.[/p] [p]“Welcome back!” Lara says. “What was it like being a bat?”[/p] [p]“How did it happen?” Martin wants to know.[/p] [p]You don't even know where to begin.[/p] [p]Besides, you're sick of the whole thing. You don't want to even think about flying, or eating bugs, or hanging upside down.[/p] [p]“I promise I'll tell you all about it,” you tell them. “But not now. It will be my scary story the next time the Horror Club meets.”[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]There's no sign of your backyard, and you don't recognize any of the houses. And where is the crypt? You don't have a clue.[/p] [p]To make things worse, your bat eyes don't see well enough to help you figure out where you are.[/p] [p]But your ears are a different matter. You were working so hard learning to fly, you didn't pay much attention to your bat hearing. But now you notice that it's excellent.[/p] [p]In fact, it's so good that if you really concentrate, you can get a clear picture of the things making sounds around you.[/p] [p]Off to the right, you hear a big moth flapping its wings. The flapping sounds like soft clapping. Somehow, the sound gives you a complete image of the moth. Below you, the loud humming of a mosquito sounds like a jet taking off.[/p] [p]This is pretty cool![/p] [p]Now your super-sharp ears hear something more familiar. Something that might help you figure out where you are. You turn toward the sound. You see a man and a woman walking a small dog in the early-morning darkness.[/p]
p.next: If you ask the couple for help
If you decide to fly off on your own

p.text: [p]You've decided to climb into the crypt through the hole. The stone wall looks way too heavy to budge. The crypt is covered with thick carvings, so it's easy to climb up to the top. You push your arms and head into the hole and start to wriggle through.[/p] [p]It's so dark inside, you can't see a thing. As soon as you get your shoulders through, you hear a sound that makes you freeze.[/p] [p][em]SCRUNK! SCRUNK![/em] It sounds as if something slimy is climbing up the wall toward you. And now you hear another sound – a low moan. There's a moaning [em]something[/em] climbing your way. Maybe this wasn't such a good idea. You try to wriggle back out – but discover you're stuck![/p] [p][em]SCRUNK! SCRUNK![/em] The moaning thing is coming closer.[/p] [p]You push and pull. You twist and turn. Nothing. You can't budge.[/p] [p]“Help!” you scream. “Help!” Your voice echoes horribly in the stone room. You begin to kick on the outside of the crypt, hoping your friends will hear you. “Help!”[/p] [p]It's a weird feeling – to be terrified and embarrassed at the same time. You don't know which will be worse – for the moaning thing to get you, or for your friends to come to the crypt and wind up staring right at your rear[/p] [p class="end"]END[/p]

[p]“Welcome to the Blue Team,” Marcie says with a smile.[/p] [p]“Glad you're on the team,” Martin adds. He crushes your hand in a hearty handshake.[/p] [p]“So, what are we playing?” you ask.[/p] [p]“The game is called The Hunt,” Lara tells you.[/p] [p]“What are we hunting for?” you ask.[/p] [p]Marcie's voice drops down to a croaking whisper. “The creepiest, most terrifying things we can find,” she says.[/p] [p]“We vote on which team finds the scariest stuff,” Martin explains. “If you haven't chickened out by then, you'll become an official member of the Horror Club.”[/p] [p]“Don't worry about me,” you say. “I love a good scare.”[/p] [p]“Come on,” Lara says. “Let's get this game going!”[/p] [p]You follow your teammates outside. Marcie goes first. Her flashlight beam bounces around the overgrown yard, making weird yellow shadows.[/p] [p]You begin scanning the yard, but Martin stops you. “Not here,” he says. “You're the newest member. You have to pass the test!”[/p] [p][em]Test?[/em] You don't like the sound of that.[/p] [p]Martin grins and points across the street. “You go there!”[/p] [p]The cemetery![/p]

[p]“I'll take the gray rock,” you tell the wizard. You figure the glowing red stone is too obvious – it must be a trick![/p] [p]He drops the gray rock in your hand. You close your eyes. [em]Home[/em], you think. [em]Take me home.[/em] [/p] [p]You open your eyes. Nothing happens. The wizard lifts an instrument from the tray. It's long and shiny and comes to a razor-sharp point at one end. “Wait!” you cry. “Wait!” [em]There's no way anyone is going to make a mummy out of me[/em], you decide. Your eyes dart wildly around the corridor. You spot a small door at the other end. You charge through the circle of priests and barge through the door.[/p] [p]“Oh, wow!” You're standing in a room the size of a football field. Its floors are made of gleaming pink marble. The walls sparkle with real gold, and jeweled lamps hang from the ceiling.[/p] [p]A large throne stands at the far end of the room. And on it sits a very old man with a short gray beard and a crown of golden leaves perched on his head. Surrounding him are a dozen bare-chested men gripping spears.[/p] [p]The old man must be King Ra-ma-la-ma, you realize.[/p] [p]Then you hear the priests' pounding footsteps behind you.[/p] [p]Terrified, you cry out to the king. “Help!”[/p]

[p]The door to the crypt might be your only chance to return home. There's something about this monster you don't trust. Maybe it's the two heads. You need to escape – fast![/p] [p]“Our history books are over here.” The red head points to the opposite wall.[/p] [p]“Geography's on the other side,” the blue head booms. It points in the opposite direction. For a moment the monster's arms become tangled, giving you just the time you need.[/p] [p]You dash across the room and yank open the door labeled TO THE CRYPT. Then you throw yourself across the threshold.[/p] [p]And find yourself up to your neck in warm, murky water![/p] [p]“AROOOOOOOO!” howls a hideous, echoing voice. 'WHO HAS COME TO THE CRYPT OF THE SWAMP THING?``[/p] [p]Oh, no! It's the wrong crypt! Looming in the darkness is an enormous creature! It's lumpy and moist, and green slime drips from its arms and legs. Its mouth is lined with sharp, red-tipped teeth. And it's marching straight toward you![/p] [p]It looks as if this is the end.[/p] [p]But wait![/p] [p]You have one more chance, if you're brave enough. Turn back now. That's right – go back to the very beginning, and join the Horror Club again – if you dare![/p] [p class="end"]THE BEGINNING[/p]

[p]You know that Martin lives somewhere in your neighborhood. You fly around reading mailboxes until you find Martin's house.[/p] [p]But your sonar tells you that no one's home. You decide to wait. You flit all around the house, peering in windows. Finally you spot a room with posters from horror movies on the walls. This must be Martin's room. You fly in through an open window and perch upside down on the curtain rod.[/p] [p]Somehow you feel very comfortable with the floor over your head and the ceiling under your feet. You feel so relaxed that you start to doze off.[/p] [p]The next thing you know, something is squeezing you. Hard! You open your eyes. A man with a brown beard has you in his fist, and he's crushing you in his grip.[/p] [p]“Look what we have here!” he says in excitement.[/p] [p]“Be careful, Dad!” cries Martin.[/p] [p]“Don't worry,” Martin's father says. “I've got the bat trapped. It can't bite me.”[/p] [p]“I'm not a bat! It's me!” you squeak. But they don't understand.[/p] [p]“What are you going to do with it, Dad?” Martin asks.[/p] [p]“There's only one solution,” he says, shoving you in a paper bag.[/p]

[p]As the mummy case lid creaks open, you bolt up. Everything looks different. You're not in the upstairs hall of Bat Wing Hall anymore – that's for sure![/p] [p]You jump out of the case and stare some more. You are standing in a long corridor with walls made of stone. It's cold in here, and you shiver as a chill runs down your spine.[/p] [p]At the end of the corridor you spot a door. You begin to walk toward it when you hear strange voices chanting. The words bounce off the stone walls and echo loudly in your ears.[/p] [p]And then, through the door, a line of black-haired men in long white robes march in. Their eyes seem to cut right through you as they grow nearer. Chanting. Chanting. The same spooky verse over and over again.[/p] [p]“What's going on?” you demand. “Where am I?”[/p] [p]But the men don't answer you. They form a circle around you and slowly move in. Closer.[/p] [p]And closer.[/p]

[p]Wrong![/p] [p]“Tricked you again!” Debbie cries, cackling hideously. “I can't believe you fell for it! Now it's time to turn you into a monster!”[/p] [p]Connor is only inches from you now. You search frantically for a way out.[/p] [p]You tuck your head to your chest. Close your eyes and race back down the hallway – toward Debbie. You barrel right into her and knock her to the ground![/p] [p]But Nick and Connor are only steps behind.[/p] [p]“Come back!” Debbie wails at you.[/p] [p]You run. Faster. Faster![/p] [p]Down dark hallways. Footsteps pound behind you.[/p] [p]You have no idea how to get out of this house. And then you see a door. A bright green door.[/p]

[p]You hold your breath and approach the sleeping mummy. What will happen if you wake it? You move carefully. Inch by inch. You reach your hand out toward the mummy.[/p] [p][em]SNORRRRF![/em] [/p] [p]You jump back as the mummy lets out a disgusting snore. You pause. Then reach out again.[/p] [p]This time you manage to grab a small piece of bandage that is dangling from its left arm. Quickly, you pull. The bandage rips free, and the mummy didn't even move! What a sleeper![/p] [p]You have two of the four items on the list, the human bone and the mummy's bandage. Now you only need a straw from a witch's broom and three hairs from a werewolf. But time is ticking.[/p] [p][em]I've searched the downstairs pretty well[/em], you think to yourself. [em]So the other items must be upstairs.[/em][/p] [p]You spot a narrow, circular staircase behind the mummy case. Up, up, up. Around and around you go. You're getting really dizzy. And the air is ice cold up here. Your teeth begin to chatter. Suddenly the staircase ends in the middle of a musty corridor. You can turn left or right. Which way will you go?[/p]
p.next: If you are wearing a sweater or a sweatshirt, turn to the right
Otherwise, head to the left

p.text: [p]You stand outside and your skin feels like it's on fire! The sun's glare forces your eyes shut. You duck back inside, wondering what's wrong. Then you try going out again.[/p] [p]The same thing happens. For some reason, you can't stand to be out in the sun! With growing horror, the answer comes to you: You're still a bat![/p] [p]That's got to be it. You're in human form now, but the transformation must still be in effect. Bats, you remember, sleep during the day. They don't go out in the sun.[/p] [p]You need some time to think.[/p] [p]“I have a headache,” you tell your mom. “I'm going back to bed.”[/p] [p]“Are you sick?” she asks. She presses her hand against your forehead. “You don't seem to have a fever.”[/p] [p]“I'll be all right,” you tell her. “I just need to sleep.”[/p] [p]You go back to your room. You turn off all the lights and pull down the shades. Then you crawl back into bed and think about your problem. What are you going to do?[/p] [p]And then the answer comes to you![/p]

[p]You can't help yourself. You'll never see such a great display of bugs again. Quickly, you lift the lid on the exhibit, grab the biggest beetle, and pop it in your mouth.[/p] [p]“Gross!” Lara screams.[/p] [p][em]CRUNCH![/em] goes the beetle. Martin and Marcie rush over to the exhibit.[/p] [p]“Watch!” Lara says, pointing to you in horror. You know your friends are staring at you, but you can't stop yourself. You pop beetle after beetle into your mouth. They crunch deliciously between your teeth. You don't stop eating until the police arrive to arrest you for shoplifting rare insects.[/p] [p]You end up in jail. But it isn't that bad – your mom and dad bail you out in less than an hour. And while you hang upside down on the cell bars, you come up with the most amazing idea! An idea that makes you a millionaire![/p] [p]For days afterward you work in the kitchen – and in the backyard. You chop. You mix. You taste. You add more ingredients and taste again. Perfect![/p] [p]You have created the biggest craze in ice cream since Rocky Road! You make a fortune with your new flavor – Beetle Berry Crunch.[/p] [p]Ssssh! Please don't give away the secret ingredient – the one that gives it that delicious [em]crunch![/em] [/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“I'm not a dog!” you squeak at the boy. You pull away. He pulls back. You finally free yourself.[/p] [p]“DOGGIE!” Darryl repeats as he reaches for you again.[/p] [p]“I'm almost through,” Marcie calls from the kitchen.[/p] [p]You have to move fast! You grab a clawful of letters and fly to the other side of the room. Darryl starts crawling toward you. Quickly, you arrange the letters in a message:[/p] [p class="centered"]HELP ME I AM A BAT[/p] [p]You place the last letter just as Darryl reaches you. He grabs at you, but you fly up to the ceiling and perch on the chandelier.[/p] [p]Marcie returns to the living room with a bowl of Jell-O. “Here's something to eat,” she tells her brother. Then she notices the message. “Did you do that, Darryl?” she asks in amazement. “I can't believe it! You're a genius!”[/p] [p]“It was me!” you squeak from the ceiling. To let Marcie know who really wrote the message, you swoop down. She takes one look at you and shrieks. Then she grabs a flyswatter from a table and begins swatting at you.[/p] [p]This is no good. Should you give up on Marcie and escape – or try once more to communicate with her?[/p]
p.next: Escape
Or try to communicate

p.text: [p]You pull open the green door. You find yourself back in the living room. [em]This house is like a never-ending maze[/em], you think.[/p] [p]You glance behind you. No sign of Debbie, Nick, or Connor. You check your watch. It is 10:50 P.M. – you have only a little over an hour before you turn into a monster.[/p] [p]You're trying to decide what to do next when you hear a strange noise.[/p] [p][em]Thump. Thump. Scrape.[/em] [/p] [p]The noise grows louder. And louder.[/p] [p][em]Thump. Thump. Scrape.[/em] [/p] [p]You slowly turn and find yourself staring at a mummy! A six-foot-tall mummy wrapped in old, yellowed bandages that are starting to unravel. Its eyeless, mouthless, bandaged face seems to stare back at you.[/p] [p]A sour smell invades your nostrils. The smell of decay. Of rotting flesh. Of death. You gag and hold your nose.[/p] [p]Then the mummy turns stiffly and disappears down a hallway. You don't want to follow it, but you need mummy bandages for the scavenger hunt. You have to follow it. You have no choice.[/p]

[p]“Hey, listen, I'm really sorry,” you tell the witch. “But I've got to look out for myself now. I'll try to help you later.”[/p] [p]Then you grab her broom.[/p] [p]“How dare you abandon me!” the witch shrieks. She starts to mumble a string of weird words. All you can make out is something that sounds like “Amikazoomy!”[/p] [p]At that instant, the handle of the broom glows bright blue in your hand. And then the broom begins to move![/p] [p]You try to pull away. But you can't![/p] [p]Your hand is stuck to the broom![/p] [p]“Hey!” you yell. But it's too late. The broom lifts you up. Higher and higher. You wrap your arms and legs around it and hold on for your life. Then the broom starts to fly![/p] [p]“Stop!” you yell. You can hear the witch cackling in her box.[/p] [p]You zoom straight to the ceiling. Swerve to the left. Then head for the little window. Faster. Faster![/p] [p]You crash through the glass![/p] [p]The icy night air stings your face as you zoom in circles through the sky. You stare down at Bat Wing Hall. Nick, Debbie, and Connor stand on the front lawn, pointing up at you.[/p] [p]You made it out! Too bad now you'll never make it [em]down[/em] to the ground.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You realize the truth sounds too batty. Besides, it will be a lot easier to prove what happened if you're already at Bat Wing Hall. You fly outside into the light and instantly transform into a kid again. You wait for the movie to finish, then meet your friends in the lobby.[/p] [p]“Why don't you have a special meeting of the Horror Club, just for the Blue Team?” you suggest. “I never got to tell a story, and I have one that's really scary.”[/p] [p]“Good idea,” Marcie says. “This mall is boring.”[/p] [p]“I have to go home first,” Lara announces.[/p] [p]“Me, too,” agrees Martin. “We'll meet at Bat Wing Hall in an hour.”[/p] [p]It's cloudy, and you're able to ride the bus almost all the way to the mansion. The sunlight only stings a little as you make your way up the hill to the old house.[/p] [p]Your friends better arrive before dark, you think. You know how tough it is to get anyone to listen to you while you're a bat. You glance over at the cemetery and shudder. That's where all your problems began. You breathe a sigh of relief once you've passed it by.[/p] [p]But your relief doesn't last long.[/p] [p]“HALT!” a voice rumbles. You could swear you felt the ground shake. What do you do?[/p]
p.next: If you halt
If you make a run for it

p.text: [p]“I think I know what it's doing,” Martin repeats. “It must be practicing flying. It looks kind of cool. I wish I could be a bat.”[/p] [p]This is ridiculous.[/p] [p]You're starting to get mad. You fly back across the street again. But this time you keep going. You head straight for the Krupnik Crypt.[/p] [p]“It wants us to follow it!” Lara guesses. Finally! You knew you liked Lara best. She runs after you. The others follow close behind. Soon all four of you are gathered in front of the crypt.[/p] [p]“I wonder why it led us here?” Marcie asks. They all stare at you expectantly.[/p] [p]How can you make them understand that the door needs to be shut? You hover over the dreadful words: WHO TURNS THE STONE WILL GROW BAT BONES.[/p] [p]Marcie watches you, then peers at the words. “Maybe the crypt has something to do with the transformation,” she says.[/p] [p]“Yes!” you squeak. “That's it!” But of course they can't understand you. How can you get them to close the door?[/p] [p]Land on the metal ring on the door? Or fly into the crypt?[/p]
p.next: If you decide to fly into the crypt
If you decide to perch on the ring

p.text: [p]“Okay,” you say. “Go ahead.”[/p] [p]“You asked for it,” Nick says. He glances at Debbie and Connor. They nod with excitement.[/p] [p]What's going on? you wonder.[/p] [p]Slowly Nick brings his hands up to his cheeks. He hooks his thumbs under his chin … and rips his face right off![/p] [p]You gasp. The head of a green-skinned reptilian monster stares out at you from the top of Nick's body. Slimy scales cover his face and begin to spread down his arms and hands![/p] [p]“N-N-Nick?” you choke out.[/p] [p]The monster grins at you – with six-inch-long fangs! Its beady yellow eyes gaze at you hungrily.[/p] [p]You turn to Debbie and Connor. And scream.[/p] [p]They are peeling off their kid faces, too![/p] [p]You gape in horror at Debbie. Her skin is now purple and covered with hideous, oozing warts. Her eyes have turned completely white and seem to bulge out of her head. And her hair – it's wriggling with enormous black tarantulas![/p] [p]Now you know the truth. These kids are monsters![/p]

[p]“What game?” you ask Debbie, your voice trembling.[/p] [p]“The scavenger hunt,” she declares.[/p] [p]“If you can find all four items on the list before midnight,” Nick adds, “then we'll let you go. If you fail, you will be trapped here with us [em]forever[/em] and turned into a monster. Not much of a choice, huh?”[/p] [p]Your knees shake as you review the scavenger hunt list in your mind. Where will you ever find werewolf hair and mummy bandages? Then again, you don't have many options.[/p] [p]But maybe, you think, you can use the time to search for an open window and escape.[/p] [p]“You've only got two hours,” Connor growls, looking at the tiny watch on his huge wrist. “You'd better get started.”[/p] [p]“You can begin here on the main floor, or go upstairs,” Nick tells you, his reptile tongue darting in and out of his mouth. “It's your choice.”[/p]
p.next: Stay on the main floor
Try your luck upstairs

p.text: [p]You're hanging onto the elevator railing by one hand now.[/p] [p]You start to say your prayers, when you hear a strange whooshing sound. A bright blue glow fills the dark airshaft. You glance down. It's the witch's broom, glowing blue, floating up through the air. You bellow with joy![/p] [p]The next thing you know the magic broom swoops underneath you. Without thinking, you throw your arms around the broom handle.[/p] [p]And you're off![/p] [p]With a loud [em]WHOOSH![/em] the broom flies you down to the basement. What a ride! You leap off the broom, onto solid ground.[/p] [p]You're safe, you think. And then you hear the snarling.[/p] [p]You spin around and spot a furnace belching bright yellow flames. And next to it sits a huge cage – with a pacing, snarling werewolf inside![/p]

[p]“I can't believe it! A bat sending me a message!” Marcie exclaims. She beckons to you. “Here, bat. Here, bat. Let me get a better look at you.”[/p] [p]Gratefully, you fly over to her. Quick as a cat, she grabs you and shoves you in a drawer. “Hey!” you squeak. “Let me out of here!” “This is so cool!” you hear Marcie saying. “A bat that can spell! We can go on TV! We'll be famous!”[/p] [p]“I'm not a bat!” you cry. “I'm a human! Let me finish my message!”[/p] [p]But Marcie isn't interested in your message. “I'll find a box to put it in,” she says to herself. Your super bat ears hear her leave the room. A moment later the drawer opens. Darryl's wide eyes stare straight at you.[/p] [p]“DOGGIE!” he cries.[/p]

[p]“Yes! Help!” you cry, still frozen in place.[/p] [p]Then you hear Connor's deep, rumbling laughter. “You fell for it! You fell for our trick!” he taunts.[/p] [p]“What trick?” you ask.[/p] [p]“The force field. You're trapped in a force field!” Connor tells you. Debbie and Nick laugh along with him. “Force field!” you exclaim. “Turn it off! Let me out of here!”[/p] [p]“Sssorry,” Nick says with a reptile-like hiss. “You can't escape from Bat Wing Hall!”[/p] [p]“That's right,” Debbie sneers. “The force field doesn't turn off until one minute after midnight.”[/p] [p]“That's one minute [em]after[/em] you've turned into a monster!” Connor leers.[/p] [p]Then the monsters lumber down the stairs, leaving you alone. Trapped in the force field. You glance at your watch. Time is ticking away.[/p] [p]You struggle, trying to break through. But you can't budge.[/p] [p]You're stuck.[/p] [p]Stuck until midnight.[/p] [p]Until it's time. Time for a monster of a change![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]Before the king can speak, one of the priests throws his arms around your throat. “Come with me!” he snarls.[/p] [p]“Stop!” the king orders, before the priest can drag you too far. “Who are you?”[/p] [p]“I'm just a kid,” you try to explain. “I don't know how I got here. But I really want to go home.”[/p] [p]“Let the intruder go!” the king orders the priest. Then he turns to you. “I don't know how to help you return,” he admits. “But I like you. And I would be honored if you would agree to stay here with me.”[/p] [p]You don't know what to do. Should you stay with the king or leave the palace?[/p]
p.next: If you accept the king's offer
If you decide to leave the palace

p.text: [p]You wake up the next morning in your own bed, feeling normal. You scrunch your eyes tight and raise your hands to your face. You're almost afraid to look. You count to three and force your eyes open. Hooray! No more bat wings! Your hands are back! Everything that happened the night before must have been a dream![/p] [p]A terrible dream.[/p] [p]You rush to the bathroom to examine your face in the mirror. There's no trace of whiskers, or fur, or big bat's ears. You've never been so happy to see your goofy grin! You brush your teeth, comb your hair, and get dressed – whistling the whole time. You skip down the stairs and into the kitchen. The aroma of pancakes cooking fills the room. “How many pancakes this morning?” your mom asks.[/p] [p]“Three,” you tell her. You pour a ton of syrup on the stack and start to eat. But today, the pancakes don't taste good. They're too soft, and the syrup is too sweet. You can't help thinking they'd be better with [em]beetles[/em] on them.[/p] [p]“I think I'll eat later,” you tell your mom. You stand and slip on a jacket. You step outside into the bright sunshine.[/p] [p]And discover you've made the biggest mistake of your life![/p]

[p]You swoop over to the couple. You're just about to ask them for help when the woman notices you. “A bat!” she shrieks. “A bat! Help!” Her scream is so loud it scares [em]you![/em] You try to fly away. But you still don't have much control.[/p] [p]You swoop in the wrong direction – right into her long hair![/p] [p]You're completely trapped! Your mouth is full of wiry hairs. Hairs wrap themselves around your neck and pull at your claws. You struggle to free yourself, but this only makes it worse.[/p] [p]“AAAAAAAACK!” the woman screams.[/p] [p]“Get away!” the man shouts. He grabs for you.[/p] [p]“I'm not really a bat!” you yell. But all that comes out is a squeak.[/p] [p]The woman swats at you – hard! Suddenly you're free. You flutter up, away from the couple. From the top of a streetlight you see a welcome sight – your own house![/p] [p]You've had enough flying for one night. Wearily, you flutter home. You swoop in through your open window and decide to try again in the morning.[/p]

[p]Once again you're in total darkness.[/p] [p]But at least the crypt door is closed. The stone has been turned. You hope [em]you've[/em] been turned, too – turned back into a kid.[/p] [p]You wait a few minutes and then stretch out your arms. Your heart sinks. Your fingers are still webbed and still attached to your bat wings. Closing the crypt didn't do anything.[/p] [p]Now you use your bat sonar to examine the inside of the crypt. You notice something you didn't see the last time you were here. There's a crack on the floor of the crypt. You swoop down to investigate. The crack is wide, and deep. It seems to lead straight into the ground. You find these words chiseled along the crack:[/p] [p class="centered"]WHO ENTERS HERE WILL BE[/p] [p]Will be what? you wonder. Unfortunately, the last part of the writing has crumbled away.[/p] [p]Still, this looks like the same writing you saw on the door of the tomb. Are the missing words TRANSFORMED BACK?[/p]

[p]“Uh, I think that's Martin,” you tell Lara and Marcie. The three of you exchange a glance, then stare up at the clumsy bat. There's no doubt about it. Martin turned the ring, so he has been transformed.[/p] [p]“How can we turn him back into a kid?” Marcie asks.[/p] [p]“Maybe if we open the door again,” Lara suggests. She reaches for the crypt door.[/p] [p]“No!” you cry. “We don't know what will happen –”[/p] [p]But it's too late. As soon as Lara opens the door she vanishes. But Martin is still a bat![/p] [p]“Where's Lara?” Marcie cries.[/p] [p]“[em]RIBBIT![/em] ” You look down at your feet. A small frog is hopping up to you. “[em]RIBBIT![/em] ”[/p] [p]“I think she's been turned into a frog,” you reply.[/p] [p]“This is terrible,” Marcie cries. “What can we do?”[/p]

[p]“Member of the Horror Club, prepare to accept your punishment!” the ghost roars.[/p] [p]“Wait!” you yell, leaping backward. “I've already [em]been[/em] punished! When I was at the Horror Club Friday night I opened your tomb and was turned into a bat!”[/p] [p]“So that was you!” the professor's ghost exclaims. “Far worse could have happened. But I suppose that's punishment enough.”[/p] [p]“But I don't want to be a bat!” you plead. “I want to be a human!”[/p] [p]“Hmmm,” the ghost says after a moment. “Perhaps we can help each other. If you will assist me in getting rid of those pesky kids – I'll help you turn back into your true form.”[/p] [p]“How do I know you'll do it?” you ask. “Change me back now, and then I'll help you.”[/p] [p]“No!” the ghost thunders. “That's my offer. Take it or leave it!”[/p] [p]Can you trust Professor Krupnik's ghost? Should you help him get the Horror Club members out of his house? You don't really have a choice. Besides, he's probably the only one who can unbat you.[/p]

[p]Your heart pounds wildly as the chanting men surround you.[/p] [p]“Halt!” a deep gravelly voice calls out. A tall, white-bearded man dressed in long blue robes has magically appeared behind you. He is holding a clay tray with pots and jars and some creepy instruments you've never seen before.[/p] [p]“Who are you?” you cry. “What's happening?”[/p] [p]“I am the wizard,” the man says. “You are in the Palace of Ra-ma-la-ma, an unimportant Egyptian king.” He points to the chanting men. “These are the king's priests. And legend decrees that anyone who enters these chambers must be turned into a mummy!”[/p] [p]“A m-mummy?” you cry. “But I came here by accident!”[/p] [p]“No matter,” scoffs the wizard. “Prepare to be mummified!”[/p] [p]“Wait!” you plead. You give the wizard your most pathetic look. He takes pity on you.[/p] [p]“I will give you one chance to escape,” he declares.[/p] [p]The wizard sets the tray down. He reaches into his robe and pulls out two stones. In his right hand is a glowing red stone. In his left hand is a dull gray rock. “One stone is an enchanted stone,” he explains. “It will return you to where you came from. The other stone is an ordinary rock. Pick one.”[/p]
p.next: If you choose the red stone
If you prefer the gray rock

p.text: [p]You decide to cross the river. Just beyond the sign, you notice a rowboat, almost hidden in the mist.[/p] [p]“Want a ride?” asks a deep voice.[/p] [p]You can just make out a figure in a dark cloak sitting at the oars of the boat.[/p] [p]Your skin crawls at the sight of him. His face is skull-like, the bones jutting out like a skeleton's. The last thing you want to do is get any closer to this evil-looking creature, but you have no choice. You have to return to the crypt. You step into the rowboat. Without another word, the oarsman begins to row. You shiver as the boat makes its silent way across the murky river. Finally, the boat docks on the other side and you climb out.[/p] [p]You want to ask directions but the oarsman is already turning the boat around. “Hey,” you call out, and wave to get his attention. To your horror, you can see right through your hand.[/p] [p]You turn back around and are relieved to spot the Krupnik Crypt just ahead. You make your way to the entrance and notice the list of the dead people buried there.[/p] [p]The last name on the list looks as if it has just been carved. You lean in to read it and gasp! There on the stone, in undeniable lettering, is your own name … and just two more words …[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You flap your wings frantically, trying to escape the paper bag. It's no use – you're trapped![/p] [p]You feel the bag being lifted and carried through the house, down the stairs, and outside into the cool night air. You hear the slam of a door, then the rumble of an engine. You're in a car! But where are you going?[/p] [p]About ten minutes later, the car screeches to a stop. You are picked up and carried across a winding footpath.[/p] [p]“Here we are!” Martin's dad announces.[/p] [p]“Thank you so much,” a strange, deep voice replies. “It is always wise to bring lost wild animals to the zoo. We can protect them here. This bat will be much happier with all the other bats in the Bat House.”[/p] [p]Bat House? Zoo? Is this guy serious? you wonder.[/p] [p]Suddenly, the bag opens wide and you are nudged out. You flap your wings, confused and disoriented. Then you hear a cage door click shut.[/p] [p]And the flutter of hundreds of bat wings![/p] [p]There are bats – [em]everywhere![/em] Swarming around you, swooping down on you. You head for a corner, terrified. A large bat zooms over and brushes up against you. You try to blend into the wall, but the bat moves closer and closer.[/p] [p]Too bad. It looks as if this bat is [em]batty[/em] over you![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“Get away,” you cry out to the monsters. “I don't need your help.” The three monsters laugh and laugh. You try to ignore them. And concentrate on moving.[/p] [p]“He doesn't get it,” you hear Nick whisper to Debbie. “He doesn't know he's trapped in a force field.”[/p] [p]A force field? Oh, no![/p] [p]You've got to find a way out. Somehow. But how?[/p] [p]You can't move forward. You can't move backward.[/p] [p]You squeeze your eyes shut and struggle against the invisible field. But it seems to be getting stronger the harder you fight. Frustrated, you let your body go limp.[/p] [p]And then you notice something. The areas where your muscles are totally relaxed aren't tingling quite so much! Maybe that's the key! Maybe the force field is activated by your fear![/p] [p]You flop onto the stairs. You close your eyes. You concentrate on fun, happy things. Cake with ice cream. Swimming in the ocean. Playing baseball with your friends.[/p] [p]You start to fall down the stairs. You did it! You freed yourself. You breathe a long sigh of relief. Then you scramble down the stairs and return to the living room.[/p]

[p]You've decided to escape. Marcie's aim is too good with that flyswatter. You swoop out of the living room as fast as you can.[/p] [p]Marcie's right behind you, chasing you down a narrow hallway. You come to a dead end.[/p] [p]Desperately, you try to duck past her. The open window you used before was in the living room. No way you'll get back to it now.[/p] [p]“I'm not a bat!” you squeak again, but you know it's hopeless.[/p] [p]“Come back here!” Marcie shouts. She swats at you again, brushing one of your wings. You stagger against a wall and almost fall to the ground.[/p] [p]You've got to escape from her![/p] [p]You spot a staircase leading to the second floor a few feet ahead. To your left is what appears to be the kitchen.[/p] [p]Quick! Choose an escape route and get out of the hall![/p]
p.next: If you fly to the kitchen
If you escape up the stairs

p.text: [p]“Help!” Lara shrieks. “It's got me!” She struggles as the hand begins to pull her into the ground. “What is it?” Marcie yells, terror in her voice. “It's a corpse!” Martin cries. “It's pulling her under!”[/p] [p]You throw your arms around Lara, but you're no match for the powerful creature dragging her down. A moment later, you feel something clutching your own ankle.[/p] [p]“No!” you scream. “No!”[/p] [p]You hear Marcie and Martin screaming and see that rotting hands have grabbed them, too. All four of you are being pulled deeper and deeper into the soft, rotten-smelling ground.[/p] [p]“Help us, Professor Krupnik!” you call. You're up to your neck in the soil. “I got them out of the house! Now save us!”[/p] [p]At first there is no answer. Then you hear an evil-sounding, ghostly chuckle. “Why would I want you to meet in my graveyard any more than in my mansion?” the ghost asks.[/p] [p]You start to protest, but your mouth is filling up with dirt. Too bad, it looks as if you learned a lesson the hard way – never trust a ghost![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“I made it!” you cry. “I'm safe!”[/p] [p]Then you see Nick strolling down the hallway toward you. His long reptile tail drags behind him, sending up clouds of dust.[/p] [p]“It's all over!” he calls triumphantly.[/p] [p]“What do you mean?” you cry.[/p] [p]“I mean – too bad,” Nick sneers. “You didn't find all the items in time. You lose.”[/p] [p]“Hold on,” you protest. “I still have an hour.”[/p] [p]“Check your watch,” Nick hisses. “It's now one minute to midnight.”[/p] [p]You gaze at your watch. “Oh, no!” you cry out. To your horror, you see that Nick is right. You were sent back an hour later than when you left![/p] [p]Now you feel your teeth begin to lengthen and grow down over your lips. Enormous warts pop out all over your skin. Your body hunches and your arms sweep the ground. Sorry! The red stone wasn't much help. It returned you to your own time at the WRONG time![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You listen to the monsters talk. “It's almost midnight,” Connor says. “Soon our friend will join us,” Nick adds. “It's good to have some new blood,” Debbie agrees.[/p] [p]You press your ear closer and continue to listen.[/p] [p]“I can't believe the Horror Club has been around for five hundred years,” Nick says. “We've had so many members.”[/p] [p]“Yeah,” Debbie agrees. “It's too bad we lose so many of them. I don't understand why this house turns most of our new members to stone.”[/p] [p]Nick starts to speak again. But you stop listening. Turn to stone? Can that be true? Forget the scavenger hunt, you say to yourself. Just find a way to leave![/p] [p]But you can't. You can't move. Not a muscle.[/p] [p]You have become strangely stiff. Your feet feel as heavy as rocks. Then you look down to see that your feet [em]are[/em] [/p] [p]rocks![/p] [p]Too bad! It looks as if the only thing left for you to do is join a rock group![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“The game is called The Hunt,” Marcie tells you. “I am captain of the Blue Team. Nick is captain of the Red Team.”[/p] [p]You watch as Nick picks Debbie and a skinny boy named Connor to be on his team. Connor has short bristly hair and a very strange smell. As Connor walks by, you decide he smells as if he's been lying in a Dumpster![/p] [p]For the Blue Team, Marcie chooses a beautiful girl with long blond hair and green eyes. Her name is Lara. She smiles shyly at you. Marcie also picks the guy in the muscle shirt.[/p] [p]“Hi, I'm Martin,” the kid says, pounding you on the back. “Welcome to the Horror Club!” He laughs, then flexes his muscles. You step back. Martin's arm is bigger than your whole body![/p] [p]“That's three on each team,” Marcie announces. “Our new member can join either one.” She turns to you. “It's up to you. Which team will you join?”[/p] [p]Would you rather hang out with Nick, Debbie, and Connor on the Red Team? Or get to know Lara, Marcie, and Martin on the Blue Team?[/p]
p.next: To join the Red Team
To join the Blue Team

p.text: [p]You need only one bone. You take a deep breath and grab hold of the skeleton hand. The yellowed fingers feel icy cold. You grasp the pinky and twist. It comes loose with a sickening snap. You drop it in your pocket, and try not to think about it. Too much.[/p] [p]You glance at the list again. Now all you have to do is find the three other items – three hairs from a werewolf, a straw from a witch's broom, and a piece from a mummy's bandage. [em]The faster, the better[/em], you think.[/p] [p]You dart out of the kitchen and return to the dining room.[/p] [p]“[em]Psst. Psst![/em] ”[/p] [p]You gaze around nervously.[/p] [p]“Over here!” Debbie whispers from a shadowy corner.[/p]

[p]You turn to the left and jog down the narrow hallway. You listen for the three monsters. But all you hear are your own sneakers slapping against the floorboards as you run.[/p] [p]The end of the hall is dark – pitch-black. You wish you had a flashlight. You can't even see your own feet![/p] [p]You slow down and place one hand on the wall to guide you. You wonder if you should turn back. Then you feel something – something rough and bristly.[/p] [p]Your fingers tighten around it. You squint in the blackness.[/p] [p]It's a rope. No, you realize suddenly, it's a rope [em]ladder![/em] [/p] [p]The ladder runs up the wall. You decide to climb it. You've got nothing to lose, you figure. And there might be a way out at the top![/p] [p]You grab on tightly to the rope and begin to climb. The rope rubs roughly against your hands, making them burn, but you ignore the pain and keep climbing.[/p] [p]The ladder sways from side to side with each step. Your stomach lurches, but you continue on. You concentrate on not looking down.[/p] [p]Then you hit the final rung.[/p] [p]You carefully reach a hand up to the ceiling and feel a sliding door![/p]

[p]You approach the heavy stone door of the crypt. Instead of a doorknob, it has a thick iron ring. Chiseled into the stone above the ring are these words:[/p] [p class="centered"]WHO TURNS THE STONE WILL GROW BAT BONES[/p] [p]What could that possibly mean? you wonder. A sudden movement draws your attention. Near the top of the crypt you see a small hole – about your size. While you watch, a tiny black bat flies out of the hole and flutters off into the night.[/p] [p][em]Outrageous[/em], you think. Maybe you can catch a bat inside the crypt. That would win the contest for sure.[/p] [p]But how will you get inside? The door is covered with cobwebs. Obviously, it hasn't been opened in a long time. Maybe you could climb to the top of the crypt and crawl in through the hole the bat came out of.[/p] [p]Or maybe you should just try to pull the big stone door open. It might work.[/p] [p]Which will you try?[/p]
p.next: If you crawl in through the hole
If you try to open the stone door

p.text: [p]You've decided to find the cemetery on your own. You're a little concerned about how the couple might react to a talking bat.[/p] [p]You begin to fly up, as high as you can go. Soon your whole neighborhood lies below you, as tiny as the town in a model train set. You scan the houses and streets. You have to peer hard – your bat vision isn't very good. But then you see it – the cemetery across the street from Bat Wing Hall.[/p] [p]You swoop toward the cemetery, but a stiff wind blows you in the other direction. You struggle to get back on course, but you're still not very good at flying.[/p] [p]You fight the gusty wind and finally reach the cemetery. You aim at a tree and land clumsily on the tip of a branch. You notice that the sky is beginning to grow light – you've been out all night![/p] [p]You yawn, then glance around the cemetery. You spot the Krupnik Crypt behind some trees. You fly toward the crypt and notice that the door is still wide open. You swoop inside just as the sun begins to rise.[/p] [p][em]CLANG![/em] The stone door slams shut behind you.[/p] [p]You're trapped![/p]

[p]You stare at Nick, Debbie, and Connor's gruesome faces. There's no question they're monsters. Real monsters.[/p] [p]“Let me out of here!” you cry.[/p] [p]Nick still blocks the door. You spot a window in the living room. You take a deep breath and race for it.[/p] [p]You're fast. You always win the fifty-yard dash at school. But against these monsters, you're not fast enough.[/p] [p]Debbie easily beats you to the window. The tarantulas scurry through her spiderweb hair, as she cackles, “There's no way out!”[/p] [p]“Please, let me go home,” you plead. “I won't tell anyone your secret. Just let me go.”[/p] [p]“No way!” Nick cries, as he enters the living room with Connor. “There's no escape from the Horror Club.”[/p] [p]“Well,” Debbie says, “that's not exactly true. There is [em]one[/em] way out.”[/p] [p]You gaze around the room, searching frantically for an exit. The three monsters circle you. You don't see any way past them. “Where is it?” you ask. “How do I get out?”[/p] [p]Nick glares at Debbie.[/p] [p]“Your only hope,” Debbie says, ignoring Nick, “is to play the game.”[/p]

[p]You try to duck under the tidal wave of mud. But the force is too strong. You are sucked deeper and deeper into the mud.[/p] [p]But Nick jumps over the wave. And he makes it![/p] [p]“You lost!” Nick cries in triumph.[/p] [p]“Wait –” you cry. “Let me –”[/p] [p]“Forget it!” Connor roars. “We made a deal! Now just hold still, and it will be over in a minute.”[/p] [p]You drop your head into your hands. In a few minutes, you'll be a monster, too.[/p] [p]You try to look on the bright side – you'll still be able to play video games. In fact, you're ready to ask Nick for a rematch.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“Let's check out the science store,” you tell your friends. Maybe there will be something there that will help you with your problem.[/p] [p]“Cool!” Lara exclaims. She leads the way to the upper level. A big banner hangs in front of a store declaring UNCLE ED'S SCIENCE EMPORIUM. [em]This looks promising[/em], you think. You push through the door, and the others follow you.[/p] [p]“Look at this great gear!” Martin says. “There's all kinds of kits and experiments.”[/p] [p]“Cool!” Marcie points to an exhibit where you can examine your own fingerprints under a magnifying glass.[/p] [p]“What are [em]those?[/em] ” Lara asks. You follow her to an exhibit of tropical insects. The insects are inside a glass case. You gaze at them in fascination. They're all colors of the rainbow, and some of the beetles are as big as mice![/p] [p]“Yuck!” Lara says.[/p] [p]You don't pay any attention. Staring at the insects has reminded you how hungry you are. Instead of flying around and eating a couple of dozen moths, you could eat just one of these beetles for a whole meal![/p] [p][em]No[/em], you tell yourself. [em]No, no, no![/em] But as you continue to gaze at the beetles, your mouth begins to water. Suddenly, the bat in you takes over.[/p]

[p]You've got to go back to the Krupnik Crypt – right now![/p] [p]Luckily, your mom works on Saturday. “Are you sure you'll be all right?” she asks, poking her head into the dark bedroom before she leaves.[/p] [p]“I'm fine,” you tell her. “Just tired.” The second you hear the front door slam, you pull on a turtleneck, a heavy coat, gloves, dark glasses, and a hat. That should protect you from the sun.[/p] [p]Only it doesn't. You manage to get as far as the end of the driveway before your skin starts to blister.[/p] [p]You'll have to wait until dark.[/p] [p]That evening you tell your parents you're going to a movie with a friend. From the window in your room, you watch the sun sink below the horizon. As soon as it sets, you turn to leave for the mansion.[/p] [p]But the floor has suddenly become very far away. You watch in horror as black hairs sprout all over your arms. Your fingers stiffen, and black webs spread between them. Your mouth tingles as fangs burst through your gums. You hang your furry head as you realize the sad truth:[/p] [p]You're a bat – again.[/p]

[p]Four kids sit in a circle on the living room floor. A big yellow candle flickers in the center.[/p] [p]They all turn and stare at you.[/p] [p]No one seems happy to see you.[/p] [p]You stand awkwardly as Nick introduces you and says, “This is our newest member.”[/p] [p]“What are you talking about?” cries a girl with short, curly red hair. She glares at you.[/p] [p]“I've brought a new member to the Horror Club,” Nick repeats.[/p] [p]“Not today!” exclaims a large boy with bulging arm muscles.[/p] [p]“Why not?” Debbie asks, squirming next to you.[/p] [p]“Didn't anyone tell you?” asks another girl. “Tonight's the special night. You've got to get that kid out of here. We're not telling stories tonight. The plan has changed!”[/p]

[p]“What was that noise?” Lara cries, glancing up. And then she sees you. “A bat!” she shrieks. “Gross, a bat!” She jumps off her bed and tears out of the room.[/p] [p]A moment later she returns with a big can of bug spray.[/p] [p]“Get out of here!” she shrieks. She turns the nozzle at you and presses her finger down on the spray button.[/p] [p]You don't know if bug spray can hurt bats, and you don't want to find out. You swoop out the window before the spray can reach you.[/p] [p]“Don't come back!” Lara screams, slamming the window shut.[/p] [p]You're so upset, you can barely flap your wings as you fly home. How are you ever going to get anyone to help you? Will you have to remain a bat for the rest of your life?[/p] [p]You slip into your room, wondering what to do. You flutter over to your bed. There's a note on your pillow from your mom: [em]Lara called. Meet her at the fountain in the mall at 3:00 tomorrow.[/em] [/p] [p]You immediately feel better.
